1. **^** In ATP Tour and Grand Slam main draw matches, Summer Olympics, Davis Cup, Laver Cup and ATP Cup; 1st in the Open Era
2. **^** In ATP Tour and Grand Slam main draw matches, Summer Olympics, Davis Cup, Laver Cup and ATP Cup;
3. **^** All different Masters event titles.[716]
4. ^ ***a*** ***b*** Australian Open, Italian Open, Wimbledon, and the Year-end Championship respectively.
5. **^** Djokovic did not play in the ninth tournament (Madrid).
6. **^** Monte Carlo, Madrid and Rome.
7. **^** Djokovic proceeded to defeat Nadal at the 2011 US Open and 2012 Australian Open, where their rankings were by then reversed.[726]

33. **^** "Stefanos Tsitsipas – New tennis star from the land of ancient Greece". *Tennis World USA*. 18 December 2017. Archived from the original on 7 August 2020. Retrieved 12 August 2018.

</fragment>
<fragment>

In August he won his tenth title at the 2023 Los Cabos Open, defeating John Isner, Nicolás Jarry, Borna Ćorić, and Alex de Minaur in straight sets in the final. Despite this result he dropped to world No. 7 on 21 August 2023 a week before the last Major of the season. At the 2023 US Open (tennis), he lost to No. 128 Swiss player Dominic Stricker in five sets in the second round. 
On 2 November, in Paris, he recorded his 50th career win over Alexander Zverev for the season, only one of two players, male or female, to record 50 or more wins in each of the last three years, tied with Andrey Rublev. It was also his first top-10 win of the season.[133] With this win he qualified for his fifth consecutive ATP Finals. Next he defeated 16th seed Karen Khachanov to record the 300th win of his career with a straight sets victory in the quarterfinals. He became the first man born in 1998 and the seventh born in the 1990s or later to reach 300 career wins.[134][135]



## Playing style[edit]


</fragment>
</document>

<fragment>

After the US Open, Zverev returned to Europe and won his first career ATP title at the St. Petersburg Open. He recorded his first win over No. 9 Berdych in the semifinals, and No. 3 Stan Wawrinka in the final, coming back from 0–3 down in the third set.[53] At his next event, he then defeated No. 10 Thiem in the first round of the 2016 China Open for the first time in four tries this year. In doing so, Zverev became the first teenager to record three consecutive victories against top ten opponents since Boris Becker in 1986.[54][55] Zverev's third round appearance at the Shanghai Masters then helped him rise to No. 20 in the ATP rankings, making him the youngest player to debut in the top 20 since Novak Djokovic in 2006.[56]



![](image)Zverev at the 2016 US Open
### 2017: Two Masters titles, world No. 3[edit]

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
